intro: Ophiorrhiza hamiguitanensis, commonly known as the Hamiguitan mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows on the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients from them. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains sticky seeds, aiding in its dispersal by birds. Ophiorrhiza hamiguitanensis is endemic to the Hamiguitan Range, highlighting its ecological significance in the region.
